metadata.title: CVE-2024-46764 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:bpf: add check for invalid name in btf_name_valid_section()If the length of the name string is 1 and the value of name[0] is NULLbyte, an OOB vulnerability occurs in btf_name_valid_section() and thereturn value is true, so the invalid name passes the check.To solve this, you need to check if the first position is NULL byte andif the first character is printable.

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
